Hello all,

I've recently read about URI and URN in particular. In this homework, I
also stumbled over a few notes entitled "Why HTTP URIs are better than
URNs" on REST Wiki. Right now I can't reach this page (hmm...), and I don't
remember the arguments.

Does it really mean that one should use URL for names as well as addresses?
 Wouldn't it be very confusing if URL gets the meaning of "a web resource,
or possibly a name, who knows?". I like the separation of URL for addresses
and URN for names. The use of meaningless URLs in XML namespaces has shown
to be confusing. From your point of view, is URN a bad/useless technology?

Gustaf
